p:
Many bacterial members from Bacillales are considered beneficial to plant growth and also have protective effects against diseases
56 . Bacillales account for 1.35% of the bacteria detected in the present study, on average. Some isolates from the root and rhizosphere soil in the mangrove environment were phosphorus-solubilizing bacteria
57, 58 . Bacillales may play a special role in mangrove ecosystems by engaging in long term promotion of plant growth. It is possible the Bacillales promote growth by producing endospores under stressful environmental conditions and by secreting large quantities of enzymes, such as phytase, a critical component of the phosphorous cycle
59 .
